intro: Antidesma hildebrandtii var. comorense, commonly known as the Comoro antidesma, is a shrub or small tree native to the Comoros Islands. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, followed by spherical, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
